intro: Artemisia hallaisanensis var. hancei, commonly known as Chinese wormwood, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, finely divided leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has been used in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported medicinal properties. Its essential oils contain compounds such as thujone and camphor, which contribute to its distinctive scent and potential therapeutic uses.
